duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide patient care, including greeting and welcoming patients, gathering medical information, and assisting with patient intake.
Accurately measure and record patients' vital signs, prepare patients for medical examinations, assist with medical procedures, and perform basic wound care as directed by physicians.
Maintain accurate and up-to-date electronic health records (EHR) and ensure proper charting of patient information.
Administer medications and injections as prescribed by healthcare providers, adhering to the highest safety standards, and collect specimens and perform basic laboratory tests.

Provide patients with essential information on medications, treatments, and post-procedure care, and maintain medical supplies and equipment, ensuring availability and order replenishment when necessary.

education_certification.credential: High school diploma or GED required. One year experience as a Medical Assistant preferred. Orthopedic experience preferred. Graduate of a credentialed Medical Assistant Licensed Program. Current CPR certification preferred. BLS Certified preferred.
